description.narrative: Output 3.2 Communication & Social Mobilization, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: Evidence-Based Advocacy and Communication

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: In a changing political scenario, PCO leveraged collaboration with key stakeholders to generate awareness on the situation of children and adolescents within the framework of the 30th anniversary of the Convention of Children´s Rights. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of people who participate in COVID-19 engagement actions [COVIDSitRep]
Number of high-profile individuals (including GWAs, influencers, political/community/religious leaders, etc.) who publicly support/amplify UNICEF advocacy messages and initiatives
Number of articles/stories with UNICEF mentions in top-tier media outlets
Number of followers across all UNICEF social media channels
Number of initiatives that engage civil society partners and/or coalitions to advocate together with UNICEF for children
